Class JsonRpcClient::Client::Get
In: lib/json_rpc_client.rb
Parent: Request

GET requests are only made for idempotent procedures, which allows these requests to get cached, etc. (A procedure is declared idempotent on the service side, by specifying :idempotent => true.) GET requests pass all their args in the URI itself, as part of the query string. Positional args are supported, as well as named args. If a call has only a hash as its only argument, the key/val pairs are used as name/value pairs. All other situations pass hashes in their entirety as just one of the args in the arglist.

Methods

new  

Public Class methods

new(client, name, args)

[Source]

     # File lib/json_rpc_client.rb, line 145
145:       def initialize(client, name, args)
146:         if args.length == 0
147:           query = ''
148:         elsif args.length == 1 && args[0].is_a?(Hash)
149:           # If we get an array where the first and only element is a hash, we apply the hash (named args).
150:           pairs = []
151:           args[0].each do |key, val|
152:             pairs << "#{key}=#{URI.encode val.to_s}"
153:           end
154:           query = '?' + pairs.join('&')
155:         else
156:           pairs = []
157:           procpar = client.procs[name]['params']
158:           args.each_with_index do |val, i|
159:             key = procpar[i]['name']
160:             pairs << "#{key}=#{URI.encode val.to_s}"
161:           end
162:           query = '?' + pairs.join('&')
163:         end
164:         @req = Net::HTTP::Get.new(client.service_path + '/' + name + query)
165:         super()
166:       end
